sub_title: Law and Ethical Technologies for the Digital Society
summary:
Konrad is assistant professor at the Law and Tech Lab of Maastricht University. Previously, he was a doctoral researcher at the Department of Computer Science of the University of Oxford and an associate researcher at the Open Data Institute. He holds a BSc in Computer Science and Mathematics from RWTH Aachen University (Distinction) and an MSc in Computer Science from the University of Oxford (Distinction).

Konrad’s main research interests are building more sustainable digital ecosystems and using computer science techniques to answer questions relating to (technology) law. As part of this, he’s been empirically measuring the effect of data protection and privacy laws on the actual data practices of smartphone apps. The aim of this is to characterise data and platform power in the app economy and to build regulatory technologies that help law scale across millions of websites and apps. He’s also been trying to build new, autonomy–enhancing technologies and translate legal requirements into technical practice.

His work has been published in leading academic venues, like PETS, FAccT, SOUPS, and the Internet Policy Review. His research has been covered by Forbes, Wired, Vox, Der Standard, La Stampa, Le Temps, TechCrunch, and other international media. He’s been selected for the award of the Future of Privacy Forum for the Best Student Privacy Paper for Policymakers 2022, given annually to one paper worldwide. He has also been selected as a member of the expert advisory bodies of the EU’s European Data Protection Board and the UK’s Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO), two leading European data protection and privacy authorities. He has previously been interviewed by the German and UK competition authorities on concentration in digital markets. Konrad led the winning team in the United Nations Privacy Competition 2022, ahead of 195 other teams worldwide.

Konrad is the creator of TrackerControl, which is an Android privacy app with 100,000+ downloads. The app exposes hidden data flows from apps to companies. It is available in 21 languages thanks to the help of the TrackerControl community. Konrad also helped found a LegalTech startup that is funded by the Alchemist Accelerator (2–3% acceptance rate).

awards:
[{'title': 'Top Team Overall', 'description': 'Over four days, our team with the brilliant Manuj Mishra and Vishal Ramesh had to build prediction models from differentially private data. 196 teams participated from across the world, including from Harvard, Toronto and Zürich. In the end, we managed to get a 5-point lead over the second-ranked team, from a total of 100 points.', 'issuer': 'United Nations PET Lab Hackaton', 'date': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, {'title': 'Best Student Paper for Privacy Policy Makers 2022', 'description': 'My paper ‘A Fait Accompli? An Empirical Study into the Absence of Consent to Third-Party Tracking in Android Apps’ has been awarded with this year’s Student Paper Award of the FPF Privacy Papers for Policymakers.

With this award, the Future of Privacy Forum (FPF) recognises leading privacy research and analytical work that is relevant to policymakers in the United States Congress, at US federal agencies, and data protection authorities internationally.', 'issuer': 'Future of Privacy Forum', 'date': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, {'title': 'DeepMind–Oxford Scholarship', 'description': 'Funding for a PhD at the University of Oxford. Total value: £87,500

projects:
[{'title': 'PlatformControl - Download and privacy analysis of iOS and Android apps at scale', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'PlatformControl allows the download and analysis of privacy in iOS and Android apps at scale.

Previously, no similar tool existed.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Konrad', 'last_name': 'Kollnig', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Law and Ethical Technologies for the Digital Society'}]}, {'title': 'AppGenie/GreaseDroid - Choice over dark patterns in apps', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': "Together with Siddhartha Datta, I'm trying to find new ways to make mobile apps more ethical, and with fewer dark patterns.

GreaseDroid allows end-users to remove existing dark patterns directly from mobile apps.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Konrad', 'last_name': 'Kollnig', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Law and Ethical Technologies for the Digital Society'}]}, {'title': 'TrackerControl - Containing mass data collection from mobile phones', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'TrackerControl is an app that aims to inform, empower, and educate users with regards to tracking in apps, that is, collection of data about user behaviour.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Konrad', 'last_name': 'Kollnig', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Law and Ethical Technologies for the Digital Society'}]}, {'title': 'gdpr4devs.com - An Guide to GDPR for App Developers', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': "There lacks comprehensive information on how to make mobile apps compliant with data protection legislation.

Drawing on a wide range of literature, I developed a website, gdpr4devs.com, that aims to summarise developers' data protection obligations on 2 printed pages.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Konrad', 'last_name': 'Kollnig', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Law and Ethical Technologies for the Digital Society'}]}, {'title': 'IdentiSwap - Exposing the filter bubble on YouTube', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'Following discussions of my research group in Aachen, I developed a browser extension to learn more about the "bias" experienced on YouTube due to its personalisation.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Konrad', 'last_name': 'Kollnig', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Law and Ethical Technologies for the Digital Society'}]}, {'title': 'BayesByBackprop - Machine Learning with Uncertainty Quantification', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'In a team of four outstanding students, we reproduced and extended the well-known BayesByBackprop algorithm.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Konrad', 'last_name': 'Kollnig', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Law and Ethical Technologies for the Digital Society'}]}, {'title': 'Kunststadt Mülheim - Modern art in your pocket', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': 'For the art project "Kunststadt Mülheim", I worked with artists on a better access to local art events. For this, we have created an online blog and mobile applications for all relevant platforms. The technology used includes Sencha Touch, Ionic 3 and PHP.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Konrad', 'last_name': 'Kollnig', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Law and Ethical Technologies for the Digital Society'}]}, {'title': "Manufaktur-Ruhr.com - Webshop for Children's Shoes", 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': "Using the Shopware Community Edition, I set up an online store for children's dressing for a friend. For the programming, PHP and MySQL were mainly used.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Konrad', 'last_name': 'Kollnig', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Law and Ethical Technologies for the Digital Society'}]}, {'title': 'EVa - Mobile substitution schedule system', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': 'For my secondary school, I developed a mobile application to display a personal substitution schedule for teachers and pupils, including push notifications. There exist versions for iOS, Android and Windows Phone. The whole environment was established using the programming languages PHP, Visual Basic, HTML5.

To assure the continuation of the project, I founded a team and am still teaching web developers in the technologies used.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Konrad', 'last_name': 'Kollnig', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Law and Ethical Technologies for the Digital Society'}]}]
